snippet: One of the nation’s biggest counterterrorism programs has provided no useful intelligence, a report says.
abstract: Congressional report says regional intelligence-gathering offices known as 'fusion centers,' one of the nation's biggest domestic counterterrorism programs, has failed to provide virtually any useful intelligence; centers are financed by the Department of Homeland Security and created jointly with state and local law enforcement agencies.
lead_paragraph: One of the nation’s biggest counterterrorism programs has provided no useful intelligence, a report says.

headline.seo: Inquiry Cites Flaws in Regional Counterterrorism Offices
headline.main: Inquiry Cites Flaws in Counterterrorism Offices
headline.print_headline: Criticism Of Centers In Fight On Terror
